moves.1. d4: standard open I move up my white pawn to d4
moves.1... Nf6: He counters with a black knight to f6.
moves.2. c4: I try to make a pawn wall and move up to c4.
moves.2... c5: Black pawn blocks my pawn in the c rail by moving up to c5. It's a free pawn for my taking if I want from d4.
moves.3. d5: I pass the pawn and move up to d5.
moves.3... d6: Black blocks with a pawn to d6.
moves.4. e3: I put forward my pawn from base line to e3. This opens up my Queen and my bishop in f1.
moves.4... g6: Black moves pawn up to g6.
moves.5. Nf3: I bring out my knight from home row to f3. This is a stronger center position than h3.
moves.5... Bg7: Black advances his bishop to g7.
